activities: OpenTable, Inc. receives personal information, including human resources data, from the EU as a result of the operations related to various of its web sites and its relationships with its customers.  In general, the personal information OpenTable collects enables it to provide restaurant reservation services to customers and users and helps OpenTable to personalize and improve the experience at its web sites.  Activities vary depending on the goods or services provided, but often include: registration and support for services, provision of various online services, enabling sales or other transactions, and communicating with customers and users about orders, products, services and promotional offers.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
recoursemech: For human resources data: EU Data Protection Authorities (EU DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC); For all other types of data: Better Business Bureau (BBB) EU Safe Harbor dispute resolution procedure
